overview:
## Overview

You can read [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKActivitySummary] objects from the HealthKit store using an [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKActivitySummaryQuery] object. Unlike the [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKSample] subclasses,  [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKActivitySummary] instances are mutable, but changes made to the object’s properties have no affect on the values in the HealthKit store.

You can instantiate your own [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKActivitySummary] objects (if needed), but you can’t save [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKActivitySummary] objects to the store.

You can display an active summary in iOS using the [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKitUI/HKActivityRingView] class or in watchOS using the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/WatchKit/WKInterfaceActivityRing] class.

---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/healthkit/hkactivitysummary
crawled: 2025-12-06T04:02:37Z
---

# HKActivitySummary

**Class**

An object that contains the move, exercise, and stand data for a given day.

## Declaration

```swift
class HKActivitySummary
```

## Overview

You can read [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKActivitySummary] objects from the HealthKit store using an [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKActivitySummaryQuery] object. Unlike the [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKSample] subclasses,  [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKActivitySummary] instances are mutable, but changes made to the object’s properties have no affect on the values in the HealthKit store.

You can instantiate your own [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKActivitySummary] objects (if needed), but you can’t save [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKActivitySummary] objects to the store.

You can display an active summary in iOS using the [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKitUI/HKActivityRingView] class or in watchOS using the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/WatchKit/WKInterfaceActivityRing] class.

## Accessing the summary’s data

- **activityMoveMode**: The move mode that they system used for this activity summary.
- **HKActivityMoveMode**: Constants that specify the value measured by the Move ring on the user’s device.
- **activeEnergyBurned**: The amount of active energy the user burned during the specified day.
- **activeEnergyBurnedGoal**: The user’s daily goal for active energy burned.
- **appleMoveTime**: The amount of time the user spent performing activities that involve full-body movements during the specified day.
- **appleMoveTimeGoal**: The user’s daily goal for move time.
- **appleExerciseTime**: The amount of time that the user has spent exercising during the specified day.
- **appleExerciseTimeGoal**: The user’s daily exercise goal.
- **exerciseTimeGoal**: The user’s daily goal for exercise time.
- **appleStandHours**: The number hours in the specified day during which the user has stood and moved for at least a minute per hour.
- **standHoursGoal**: The user’s daily goal for stand hours.
- **appleStandHoursGoal**: The user’s daily goal for stand hours.
- **HKCategoryValueAppleStandHour**: Categories that the system used to indicate whether the user stood during the sample’s duration.
- **dateComponents(for:)**: Date components that uniquely identify the day represented by the summary object.

## Specifying predicate key paths

- **HKPredicateKeyPathDateComponents**: The key path for accessing an activity summary’s date components.

## Instance Properties

- **isPaused**

## Activity rings

- **HKActivitySummaryQueryDescriptor**: A query interface that reads activity summaries using Swift concurrency.
- **HKActivitySummaryQuery**: A query for reading activity summary objects from the HealthKit store.
- **HKActivityRingView**: A view that uses the Move, Exercise, and Stand activity rings to display data from a HealthKit activity summary object.
- **HKActivityMoveModeObject**: An object that contains a movement mode value.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
